page.title: 02Life in Sodylt Bank - 1953
page.content: Most people are engaged in agriculture although some worked at the coal mine at Ifton Heath.Most of the agricultural workers lived in tied cottages.There were no council houses at that time.The proportion of tied to private homes was about 50-50.Today there are few tied cottages and a few council houses in the area.There was electricity as a number of inhabitants bought TVs to watch the coronation of Elizabeth II.The village school closed in 1950 and so the children had to travel to St Martins.There was a daily bus service to Oswestry,Wrexham and Ellesmere.Buses are more frequent today.Mobile shops supplied daily shopping needs.Ellesmere and Oswestry were visited for other shopping. The nearest cinema was in Oswestry, theatre at Chester.Most people had radios, there were only a few TVs.
